results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of [n] with exactly k increasing runs of odd length.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} k * T(n,k) = A096654(n-1) for n > 0. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 03 2019
example: Example: T(3,1) = 5 because we have (123), 13(2), (2)13, 23(1) and (3)12 (the runs of odd length are shown between parentheses).
maple: G:=t^2/(1-t*x-(1-t^2)*exp(-t*x)): Gser:=simplify(series(G,x=0,12)): P[0]:=1: for n from 1 to 11 do P[n]:=sort(expand(n!*coeff(Gser,x^n))) od: seq(seq(coeff(t*P[n],t^k),k=1..n+1),n=0..11);
